intro: Hieracium lucens, commonly known as the shining hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium lucens is an herbaceous perennial, often forming dense colonies in its native habitat.
